review:
Tennis in the Face is a simple physics based puzzle game where you try to take out your enemies by aiming and hitting a tennis ball.
It was probably a mobile game before it made it to steam. It is extremely casual and has the same mindset of old mobile games where you get more points by using less tennis balls.
It is fairly short, took me 2 hours to beat but i didn't go for every crown. If you do so, you might get a much longer playtime.
Pretty decent game for what it is but i wouldn't buy it full price.
Only recommended on a deep sale.

review:
각도를 이용한 캐주얼 물리 게임 [b]《면상에 테니스》[/b]다. 처음 딱 플레이할 때 나 진짜 식겁했잖아. 스테이지를 클리어하니까 '왕관'이 나오는데··· 와, 그 순간 [i]'어, 이거 왕관 다 따야 되는 도전과제 있나?'[/i] 라는 생각이 들면서 바로 식은땀이 나더라. 진심, 왕관 관련된 도전과제 있었으면 고혈압으로 쓰러졌을듯. 도전과제에 스트레스를 받지 않게 하려는 개발진들의 배려에 감사를 표한다.

 + 짧은 플레이 타임
 + 쉽게 클리어할 수 있는 레벨 디자인(왕관은 무시하자)
 + 나름 나쁘지 않은 타격감
 + 도전과제 올클리어 매우 쉬운 편(커뮤니티 가이드를 필히 참조할 것)
 + 트레이딩 카드 존재(플탐 대비 파밍시간 매우 긴 편)

 - 아쉬운 점? 메뉴에서 100만점 얻는데 꽤 시간이 필요하다는 정도?

이 게임에서 [b]'메인 메뉴에서 1,000,000점 획득'[/b] 도전과제는 약간 시간이 걸리기 때문에 컴퓨터를 사용하지 않을 때 틈틈이 켜두면 된다. 알트탭이나 윈도우 화면이 안 먹혀서 그저 가만히 켜둬야 한다. 다행히 한번에 획득하는 게 아니라 누적이 되기 때문에 언제든지 종료해도 상관은 없는데, 주의할 점은 메뉴 스코어 저장하려면 레벨 선택창에 한번 들어갔다가 다시 메뉴로 빠져나온 뒤에 게임을 꺼야 된다. 안 그러면 저장 안 되니 명심할 것.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970711212', 'num_games_owned': 1569, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1594550539}
review:
Tennis in the Face is a simple geometry based puzzle game where you control a tennis player (Pete Pagassi)  to hit multiple to knock them out.

The game is set over 8 chapters, each with about 10 levels in, and should not take you more than a few hours to gather all the achievements and get the goal crown from each level (gained by finishing the level with a certain amount of balls/exploding cans left over)

The game is incredibly casual, and is something you would expect to find on an Android/iOS device, but for fans of these types of games, you will still enjoy.

The music can be incredibly grating at times as it is very repetitive and does not change throughout the entire game, and this becomes increasingly a problem if you find yourself stuck on a level. Possibly, this game is something you will want to play with the sound off, or your own music playing instead.

Overall, it's hard not to recommend the game, as although it may overstay it's welcome slightly, and lack variety, it's clear from the off what time of game this is, and the price is charges for it is not egregious, so for what it is, it's perfectly serviceable.

Best for: Energy Deficient Tennis Fans

review:
I'm not really into mobile gaming or playing a lot of these games with more casual appeal but Tennis in the Face is a surprisingly good take on the angry birdlike formula. At first impression it seems like a quick crash gab on what's a popular genre on mobile (I assume) but it really stands out on its own merits with its own unique mechanics that I at least haven't experienced in my admittedly limited experience in this genre.

Turns out using other's faces as bouncing pads is a good basis for fun physics puzzle action. So, yeah, GRAB N' SMASH!

It is a little too simple and repetitive for my taste, but this game will definitely appeal to fans of the genre. It has more interesting mechanics as you progress farther in the game which helps keep you from getting bored. Personally, I don't think any game from this genre will ever truly interest me, but this is one of the best I've played. Highly recommended for people that enjoy this style of game, lightly recommended for the average person.

review:
[h1] Ну такое... С кучей недоработок [/h1]

Для версии 1.0.7.5

Если у кого мерцает экран в полном режиме, то лучше играть в оконном.

Вроде и нормально выносить с помощью теннисного мяча всяких чудиков, но чисто промахи в дизайне мешают конкретно... Из игры нельзя выйти без клавиатуры... В главном меню вообще нет кликабельной кнопки выхода. Такое ощущение, что тут преимущество за оконным режимом.

В графическом плане довольно простая, яркая. Также игра не переведена на русский. Вроде бы переводить особо нечего, но приятней видеть родной язык. Этого тут нет. Игра занимает меньше сотни мегабайт и физика у мяча занятна. На некоторые моменты безделья вполне подойдёт. Но потом становится скучновато. Меняются здесь только карты, сам процесс не развивается - теннисист также пуляет мяч и по траектории полёта все вышибаются.

Так что так себе игра. Без русского не рекомендую.

review: Silly physics fun that is easy to pick up and play, although the "hard to put down" doesn't quite ring true as there are no leaderboards to compare your scores to or to even just peruse to see if you max-scored a level or not.  Recommended, but it would be much more challenging and replayable if there was any score-chasing as part of the game.  It does have a cute sense of humor (when you hit a cop, donuts explode from them!) which make it easy to like, and the base gameplay - launch tennis balls at your enemies, scoring extra points for headshots - progresses in difficulty as a nice curve.  For $4.99 it is perfectly priced for what is on offer.

review: Tennis in the Face is a fun physics based game where you serve a tennis ball and attempt to hit people / targets to clear the stage. The game is setup similar to Angry Birds where the stages you beat can be re-played until they are perfected. The cartoon graphics are extremely well done and it is great to see a video game puzzler that uses tennis as the theme. The story was very comical and made me laugh many times as you control a disgruntled pro tennis player on a rampage to destroy a mega energy drink company. I had previously owned this game on PS3 and Vita but was happy to pick up a 3rd copy to play on the PC. It is very fun and rewarding being able to serve tennis balls into another person's face. This game is the perfect stress reliever for any tennis enthusiast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040076212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1500989935}
review:
«Tennis in the Face» - казуальная аркада типа «машины Голдберга», в которой, пользуясь базовыми законами физики, геометрии, разрушаемостью окружения и собственной удачей, вам предстоит выбить своих врагов теннисным мячом, затратив на это как можно меньше попыток. Карты полны разнообразных препятствий, физических объектов и меняющихся типов противников, что вам необходимо использовать для максимально чистого прохождения. Всего доступно порядка 85 уникальных кортов, не считая бонусные этапы на сбор очков.

По сути, «Tennis in the Face» - именно то, чем кажется в описании и трейлерах, а именно незатейливая забавная «физическая» головоломка, достаточно разнообразная в плане ставящихся перед вами задач и недостаточно продолжительная, если вам не захочется перепройти всё на «золото». Она обладает приятным визуальным стилем, подобием сюжета и даже нераздражающим звуковым оформлением. Управление также упрощено в угоду веселью: вам даже не нужно выбирать силу удара, нужно просто задавать начальную траекторию и бить туда, куда, как вам кажется, падение мяча принесёт наибольшие разрушения. 

Единственная проблема, с которой лично мне не посчастливилось столкнуться – «рэгдолл» и физика в целом в этой игре не всегда действует так, как задумано. Вполне реальна ситуация, когда, по идее, падение одного человечка должно сбить другого рядом, сетуя на «принцип домино», но иногда этого не происходит, а цель плюхается в противоположную сторону. С предметами бывает то же самое. На одном из этапов, где подобный физический приём – единственно-верное прохождение, я застрял, так как лишь с десятой попытки удара по одинаковой траектории всё сработало так, как это задумано. И я не придумываю, поскольку перепробовал каждый возможный способ, но лишь этот давал хоть какой-то результат. Также порой сбитый человечек должен попасть в щель и упасть на что-нибудь снизу, но из-за «рэгдолла» он застревает в проёме, вытянув неудачно ногу. Из-за этого приходится проходить снова и снова.

Однако обозначенная проблема весьма условна. Если вам по душе игры подобного типа, вроде серии «Angry Birds», но с меньшим количеством режимов и условий, можете попробовать «Tennis in the Face». Хотя, как мне показалось, она гораздо больше подходит для игры в очередях, в туалете или поездках с планшета, учитывая её простоту, незамысловатость и оптимальную продолжительность лишь при условии, что вы в неё не засядете.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022266051', 'num_games_owned': 3249, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1486539848}
review:
[h1]Great graphics and neat idea, but a couple of problems left me more annoyed than entertained.[/h1]

I picked up this game because I loved the graphics and art style, and I thought the game itself was a funny idea.  When playing it however... The first thing that struck me was the annoying fake physics applied to the ball.  OK, whatever, the game was still playable and I could overlook it, so I played on and was reasonably entertained til the 7th of 8 worlds or so.

As you progress in the world and the difficulty increases, I noticed the game shifting and relying less and less on "strategy" and more and more on random chance and I was left with merely "try throwing the ball this direction and see what happens".  Which is partly brought on by the inconsistent physics applied in the game (falling objects, objects pushing other objects).  This "Random Factor" in the physics, as I call it, can be demonstrated by trying the same thing a couple times in a row, and seeing different results.  This becomes a bigger problem later on as you start relying on how objects simply fall, or how preset objects explode, etc.

[h1]The PROs:[/h1]
+ Very cool graphics
+ Great artstyle
+ I liked the over-the-top "story"
+ Last ball trajectory shown so you can tweak it a bit
+ A variety of baddies that behave differently
+ A good number of levels

[h1]The EH:[/h1]
~ Music got very repetitive, very fast.
~ Wonky physics with the tennis ball itself.

[h1]The CONs:[/h1]
[b]- Random Factor.[/b]  The same actions will produce similar but different results when "physics" gets applied.  Which gets annoying as in later levels you need things to fall on other objects or blow up which throws objects in a certain distance, or other people to fall into others, etc, etc.

[b]- Inconsistent physics for objects in the game.[/b]

[b]- Less and less strategy on later levels[/b], and simply more just throwing the ball all over til you see the effects and discover how a medal is done for that level.

[h1]Overall:  It's a great looking game and I played it for a few hours, but ended up quitting due to needing to rely on inconsistent physics.  6 out of 10.[/h1]

[i]Actual play time was approx 2.7 hrs.  The rest of the time was idling for cards and also being interrupted during play and was away from PC with game still running.  For someone to complete the game I'd anticipate approx 3.5 hrs or so.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198115158556', 'num_games_owned': 1402, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1471487400}
review:
7.7/10 - One of the Best and Most Rewarding Angry Birds Clones!

For me this is one of the more interesting Angry Birds clones. Instead of shooting birds at your objectives you are smashing tennis balls in others faces! There are 8 different zones with 16 levels in each; bringing the total to 128 levels! This sounds daunting but I breezed through these in about 2 hours. Tack on another hour to completely 100% the achievements.

You play as Pete Pagassi, an Ex-Tennis Pro who was forced to retire at the top of his game and report to rehab! Time passes and Pete kicks his dirty habit, set to return to the real world only to discover the whole town is now addicted to Explodz! Can you help Pete reach the top again and save the town with tennis balls in the face?

Overall, really fun Angry Birds clone. Better than most. Worth $3-5. 3 hours of content tops.

review:
Many people might remember that we review Tennis in the Face on the ill-fated console, the Ouya, well thankfully it made the jump to PC, and I have to say that plays as well, if not better on this console, thanks in huge part to a the fact that this game has gamepad support. You might be thinking to yourself, why would they not have gamepad support on the PC, you'd be surprised.

Now let's give you a little bit of back story, you are a disgraced tennis all-star who owes all his whoas to an energy drink called eXplodz. It is now your mission in life to use your killer serves to take out all opposition as you take revenge on the company behind eXplodz. You will have to make your way through town taking on the likes of clowns, cops, scientists,hippies, and more.

The object of each level is to try to take out all of the enemies in as few hits as possible. Utilizing the platforms, walls, and enemies you will have to bounce the tennis ball to perfection. If you can do it quickly you will gain a crown for mastery of the level, and of course the more crowns you get the more special pieces you unlock.

Graphically this game looks great. The levels are all clearly laid out, the HUD (Heads Up Display) gives you all the information that you need while not cluttering up the screen. There's also the fact that you get to see the outline of your previous hit's path. Actually to take it a step further even if you reset the level you get to see the previous hit's path, so if you are looking to get that perfect shot on the first hit you can take that approach, which is what I did several times when trying to get that crown.

Here's the deal if you are looking for a fun game with plenty of replayability and you like physics based games, you are going to HAVE to have this game in your collection. There is plenty of game here, and the fact is that this is the type of game you can pick up and put down, and pick up again with very little need to learn the system again. There's also the fact that each level is only one screen so going through one takes almost no time at all, so there's no big time sink, well that is unless you get the itch and try to go through the entire game in one sitting. This game gets a 9.2 out of 10.

review:
Okay, this game is pretty new and likely on at least a few people's radars. I've played a couple levels and probably 100 or so matches already, so I felt I would write an impressions review (mostly since there is a story of sorts, which I wont finish for a little while most likely, but when I do, I will amend this review as necessary).

Anyway, this game isn't different in philosophy to Contraption Maker, Bad Rats, and so on, except that it is more enjoyable and definitely much more humorous. It does have a story as mentioned before. Basically you are an ex tennis champ who got hooked on an energy drink and it ruined your career and your life, so now, you are on a mission to free people from its evil influence, an influence that has spread like wildfire. How? Well, via your tennis skills of course. You will roll through themed levels (clowns, cops, etc...) using your service skills to try and knock out as many enemies as possible with as few balls as possible. There are obstacles that will destroy your ball, but others than will set off chain reactions that assist you in your endeavors.


....and that is pretty much all there is to it, at least at the point I am at. 

btw....if you idle the title screen to get as many points as possible there, you will get an achievement when you hit one million points, lol.


Anyway, this is what I consider a great time waster. Just have a few minutes? This is the game for you. Have more time to spare. Ditto. In fact, while I doubt this will be most people's game du jour, it will definitely serve to fill those voids where you dont know what to play, dont have a lot of time to play, or generally are just bored but want to play something. 

Actually a very easy recommendation for me. I give it a sliding scale 6-9 out of 10 depending on your state of mind, lol.

Tennis in the Face:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  
 
You know, Tennis is one of those games that I am not…. let’s say, built for. Well, try to visualize a frog with a tennis racket in his hand… It is a bit hard to imagine, isn’t it?  Well, don’t! I have the answer for you. Just play Tennis in the face.

Tennis in the Face is an action/puzzle game with great physics. You will be playing Pete Pagassi, who will attempt to save the city from Explodz, an evil energy drink company. You will start your quest, as all good Tennis players, in a metro. You will have at your fingertips the Oddingtong Metro map and all you have to do is to get all the necessary golden crowns to unlock the next metro station.

Armed with your sensational and precise serve (hopefully, you make an ace), you will have to hit all characters in the level with your tennis ball or a can of the energy drink from Explodz. Achieve a chain reaction and knock out all your enemies with a single ball (sometime 2) and you will score the perfect game, set and match!

A well-executed game which offers over 100 levels with nice graphics and catchy music. Very easy to play, fun and the difficulty increases with each level.

Positives:
~~~~~~~
  
-	Fun Graphics
-	Easy to play
-	Over 100 levels
-	Great physics 
-	Achievements & trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~  

-	This type of game will always be a bit repetitive

Well, I know what I am going to play during each Grand Slam - Tennis in the Face!

8.5/10

I have attached a preview video covering the game and a brief write up.

This game is very chill and casual. Contrary to the title making it sound like you're a madman running around smacking people in teh face with tennis racket.

You are set in a position which you cant move and you have to aim and shoot your ball in which it bounces and reflects of walls in order to hit your targets. Your enemies at first are clowns, but then progresses on to Police and more!

The game is smooth and very relaxing - it also comes with 15 achievements however the games difficulty starts to increase when there are more objects on the screen and glass which destroys your tennis ball and stops it reflecting.

The game doesnt try to be anything special or stand out, although it does have pretty bright colors, funny humor and everything feels it works as it should.

If you're after a fun game for a cheap price then definitely get it. If you're looking for something more spectacular then maybe this isnt the game for you.
